content.en: Radar Rainfall Accuracy: Scientists have been studying the accuracy and reliability of radar-based algorithms for estimating rainfall. They have compared these algorithms with ground observations and other radar measurements to understand their sources of error and uncertainty. The agencies involved in developing and testing these algorithms include the National Space Development Agency of Japan, McGill University, Global Satellite Mapping of Precipitation, and NASA, among others. This research aims to improve our understanding of radar-based rainfall estimation and its applications in various regions and terrains.
content.da: Radar nedbørsnøjagtighed: Forskere har studeret nøjagtigheden og pålideligheden af radarbaserede algoritmer til estimering af nedbør. De har sammenlignet disse algoritmer med jordobservationer og andre radarmålinger for at forstå deres fejlkilder og usikkerhed. De agenturer, der er involveret i udviklingen og testningen af disse algoritmer, inkluderer den japanske nationale rumudviklingsagentur, McGill University, Global Satellite Mapping of Precipitation, og NASA, blandt andre. Denne forskning sigter mod at forbedre vores forståelse af radarbaseret nedbørsestimering og dens anvendelser i forskellige regioner og terræner.
